slides.title: WHAT'S SO SPECIAL ABOUT GOLD?
slides.subtitle: OXFORD DISCOVER FUTURES: UNIT 10
slides.notes: Welcome the students. Introduce the topic of gold and its value.

slides.title: YOUR MISSION: RESOURCE MANAGEMENT
slides.content:
SCAN for information

EXTRACT specific data

MASTER verb suffixes
slides.notes: Explain the objectives. Why do we need to read infographics? They are key for the PET exam and real-life data comprehension.

slides.title: GOLD: FACT OR FICTION?
slides.content:
THE CHALLENGE:

1 Gold is edible. FACT
2 All gold ever mined fits in 2 Olympic pools. FICTION (It's 3-4)
3 There is gold in your body. FACT (0.2mg)
02:00
slides.notes: Quick warmer. Students guess. Reveal the answers to spark interest.

slides.title: DECODING THE METAL
slides.content: Before we excavate the facts, let's unlock the language.

slides.title: UNLOCK THE LANGUAGE
slides.notes: Pre-teach vocabulary. Model and drill the word stress in ex-ca-vate and ma-nip-u-late.

slides.title: THE SPEED SCAN
slides.content: Don't read every word! Look for headings and numbers.

slides.title: SCANNING FOR ANSWERS
slides.content:
TASK: EXERCISE 1

  • Where did the gold on the surface of Earth come from?
  • How was gold formed in the universe?
  • Where is most of the gold on the Earth?
  • How are gold deposits formed underground?
  • What are the five main uses of gold?
02:00
slides.notes: Scanning task. Students have 2 minutes to find the answers using headings and images.

slides.title: DATA DETECTIVES
slides.content: Now look deeper. What do these specific numbers tell us?

slides.title: THE NUMBERS GAME
slides.content:
WHAT DO THESE FIGURES REFER TO?

130 million years Age of the explosion that created gold.
99% Gold in liquid form at Earth's center.
45 cm Depth of gold if it covered the Earth.
1,000,000,000 Cell phones produced each year.
slides.notes: Exercise 3. Students match the figures to their meanings.

slides.title: THE HISTORICAL RECORD
slides.content:
THE CHALLENGE: EXERCISE 4

What were the historical uses? Jewelry, currency, dentistry.
What are the benefits? Doesn't darken, easy to manipulate.

slides.title: WORD TRANSFORMATIONS
slides.content: How do we turn 'Beauty' into 'Beautify'? Suffix power!

slides.title: THE VERB FACTORY
slides.content:
VERB SUFFIXES (-ify, -ize, -en, -ate)

SuffixExample from Text
-ify beautify, solidify
-ize moisturize, specialize
-en brighten, harden
-ate excavate, manipulate
slides.notes: Vocabulary focus on verb suffixes. Students categorize words from the text.

slides.title: VALUE & VIRTUE
slides.content:
TALKING POINTS:

  • Is gold necessary for our lives? Why?
  • What factors make resources valuable?
  • Do we value any resources too much or too little?
